type1.text: Did you ask clarifying questions to understand the key metrics and their definitions?
Did you identify the applicable metric categories (acquisition, engagement, monetization, etc.)?
Did you propose specific metrics to track the product's core performance?
Did you discuss any counter-metrics or metrics to monitor potential risks?
Did you relate the metrics back to the key business objectives and user needs?
Did you showcase understanding of metric calculation methodologies?
Did you highlight any data limitations or quality concerns for the proposed metrics?
Did you suggest ways to analyze metric trends over time or across cohorts?
Did you propose a testing strategy to measure the impact of product changes?
Did you discuss any relevant tools or dashboards for metric tracking and analysis?

type2.text: How well did you prioritize the most important metrics for the business?
options: Did not discuss any metrics prioritization
Discussed prioritization but did not propose a framework
Proposed a basic prioritization framework like AARRR
Proposed a tailored prioritization framework for the product space
Proposed a nuanced, comprehensive prioritization framework linking metrics to business goals

type2.text: How insightful was your analysis of metric trends, segments, and cohorts?
options: Did not discuss any trend or segment analysis
Discussed basic trend analysis but no segmentation
Explored trends across basic segments like demographics
Analyzed trends across relevant user/product segments and cohorts
Provided deep insights by analyzing intersectional trends across multiple meaningful segments

type2.text: How solid was your methodology for metric calculation and data quality checks?
options: Did not discuss any metric calculation methodologies
Mentioned calculation formulas but with flaws or inconsistencies
Outlined metric calculation steps but did not cover data quality
Provided a sound metric calculation methodology with basic data quality checks
Outlined a robust, comprehensive methodology covering calculation, data quality, and limitations

type2.text: How effectively did you identify counter-metrics and potential risks?
options: Did not discuss any counter-metrics or risks
Mentioned 1-2 generic risks without corresponding counter-metrics
Listed some counter-metrics but did not explain their importance
Identified appropriate counter-metrics and explained their significance
Outlined specific risks, insightful counter-metrics, and mitigation strategies

type2.text: How well did you tie the metrics strategy to core business/user goals?
options: Did not relate metrics back to any key goals
Made a surface-level connection between metrics and goals
Aligned some metrics with stated goals but inconsistently
Explicitly mapped all key metrics to core business/user goals
Provided a cohesive metrics strategy fully grounded in core goals
